text:
: The Madras High Court has directed the State government to submit the draft of proposed amendment to the Chennai City Municipal Corporation Act, 1919 paving the way to impose enhanced penalty on illegal sewage connections in the city.

The issue pertains to a PIL moved by activist A. Narayanan to check manual scavenging in the State. With regard to illegal sewer connections, the report said that a penalty between Rs. 100 and Rs. 2000 had been levied on the violators. Observing that the amount charged as penalty was low, the Bench said, “The penalty should be graded from Rs. 5,000 to a couple of lakh of rupees, depending on the nature of the buildings.” When the petition came up for hearing before the Division Bench of Justices T.S. Sivagnanam and Justice R Mala, The authorities sought time to enhance the penalty submitting that the process of obtaining approval for the draft of proposed amendment from the government involves various legislative steps and administrative procedures.

The Bench posted the matter to March 7.
title: Illegal sewage connections: HC directive to govt
